Convex Functions

Convex function

  • Defintion: A function is convex if the domain is a convex set, and if for any ,
  • A function is strictly convex if the inequality is replaced by the strict equality with
  • A function is concave if -f is convex
  • Convex function is defined on the convex set
  • The definition can be extended to

for all and

  • Theorem: A function is convex if and only if is convex when it is restricted to any line that intersects its domain. That is, is convex if and only if for any , and is convex
    • 이 Theorem을 이용하면 domain 에서가 아니라 domain 에서 convex analysis 가능.
  • Proof():

Suppose that is convex. Then we need to show that is convex. Consider,

  • Proof():

Let . Then

Since is convex for any , for any

Let . Then

First order condition for convexity

  • Suppose that is differentiable. Then is convex if and only if is convex and
  • Connection with the first order necessary condition. If is optimal, then
  • is a global minimum point.
    • ch1에서 배운 first order condition for optimal point를 생각해보자.
    • 은 optimal point를 가지기 위한 일차 필요조건이였다.
    • 하지만 convex가 보장이 되면 은 이 되어 이되고
      • local optiaml문제에서 global optimal문제가 되고
      • ch1에서 배운 optimal point에 대한 일차 필요조건이 충분조건이 된다.
    • Convex의 중요성 :)
  • Proof():

We will prove the one-dimensional case. Assume that is convex. Then we have

and by taking the limit , we have the desired result

  • Proof():

Suppose now that we have the first order condition. Let . Then

Then

Second order condition for convexity

  • Twice differentiable function is convex iff is convex and
  • The Hessian must be positive semi-definite
  • For the strict convexity,

Convex Functions: Examples

Quadratic optimization probelm (like the least sqaure problem)

  • is convex iff , and is strictly convex iff .
  • The least square problem is convex
  • 증명은,intersection with an arbitrary line 을 이용해 보일 수 있다.
  • 앞에서 배운 Convex를 보이기 위한 Theorem 참고.

Convex function examples on :

  • affine:
    • 참고로 affine은 convex이면서 concave
  • exponential:
  • powers: for
  • powers of absolute value: on where
    • triangularity로 보일 수 있다.
  • negative entropy: on : 2nd order derivative is positive
  • 참고로 는 concave

Convex function examples on and :

  • norm:
  • affine function
    • affine이 convex한 것과 를 이용해 증명 가능
  • induced norm (singular value) : norm of the matrix

log-determinant function

  • Example: with
  • log-determinant가 concave한 것을 intersection with an arbitrary line을 이용해 증명해 보자.
  • where are eigenvalues of .
  • 는 에 대해서 때문에 concave함
  • 실제로 , strictly concave

Example: where

  • eigen value를 이용해 convex를 증명해 보자.
  • , 즉 모든 eigen value의 곱은 0
  • where , 즉 모든 eigen value의 합은 0보다 크다.
  • 따라서 모든 eigen value들이 0과 같거나 크므로, 는 positive semi-definite이고
  • 는 convex하다

Epigraph and Sublevel Sets

-sublevel set

  • Definition: -sublevel set of
  • sublevel set of convex functions are convex.
  • But the converse is not true
  • 즉, 는 가 보다 작은 범위 내의 domain

Epigraph

  • Definition: epigraph of :
  • A function is convex iff is convex.
  • Convex를 보이는 한 방법! (differentiable 할 필요 x)
  • Ch5에서 duality를 다룰 때 또 사용 될 것

Jensen’s Inequality

Jensen’s Inequality

  • Convex combination version: If is convex, then with and ,
  • Random vector: if is convex, then

Holder’s Inequality

  • where

Operations that Preserve Convexity

  • Scaling: if is convex, then is convex
  • Addition: if and are convex, then is convex
  • Composition with an affine function: is convex and is affine, then is convex

Pointwise maximum

  • if are convex functions, then their pointwise maximum, defined by
  • pointwise maximum is also convex

Pointwise supremum

  • If for each , is convex, then the point wise supremum
  • is convex
  • 참고로 가 convex일 필요는 없다
  • 또한

  • 가 convex하면 도 모든 y에 대해 convex하므로 는 convex하다. (왜냐하면, convex끼리의 교집합은 convex하므로)

  • 참고로

    • pointwise infimum 은 concave
    • is convex in (x,y), and is convex and nonempty, then
    • 또한 convex하다
    • 이때는 Pointwise supremum과 다르게 는 반드시 convex해야한다

Scalar composition

  • Suppose where and
    • is convex if is convex and nondecreasing and is convex
      • e.g., if is convex
    • is convex if is convex and nonincreasing and is concave
      • e.g., if is concave and positive
    • is concave if is concave and nondecreasing and is concave
    • is concave if is concave and nonincreasing and is convex

Vector composition

  • Suppose where and
    • is convex if is convex and nondecreasing in each argument and is convex
    • is convex if is convex and nonincreasing in each argument and is concave
  • Scalar composition과 같은 맥락 단 의 input이 vector

Perspective Function

  • If , the perspective of is the function defined by
  • 가 convex하면 perspective operation은 convexity 보존
  • 증명은 Epigraph를 통해 가능

내용 정리

  • 지금 까지 배운 Convex를 보이는 5가지 방법
    1. By definition
    2. By the intersection with an arbitrary line
    5. Epigraph (differentiable 할 필요 x)
